body:
When supplying a proc macro invocation to a normal macro as `tt`, `Span::call_site()` seems to be wrong.

I tried this code:
https://github.com/anuejn/proc_macro_scope_confusion/tree/125356cf4b6e7d54930031710cb3db20307b4b71

I expected to see this happen: 
The code compiles without error since the call-site of the proc macro lays in the code generated by the normal macro.

Instead, this happened: 
The call-site of the proc macro points to the invocation of the normal macro, leading to symbols being resolved in the wrong scope and generating a borrow-checker error.
